				Academic Affairs			

				Academic Affairs, led by the Provost and Executive Vice President for Academic Affairs, is responsible for Cal Poly’s academic policies, priorities, and allocation of resources for these matters.		

				Continue Reading >
			








				Colleges			

				Cal Poly has six colleges: Agriculture, Food & Environmental Sciences;  Architecture & Environmental Design;  Business;  Engineering; Liberal Arts; and Science & Mathematics		

				Continue Reading >
			








				Enrollment Services			

				The Office of the Registrar provides services regarding academic records, evaluations, and planning.		

				Continue Reading >
			








				Admissions			

				Link to the Admissions Website for information on selection criteria, application deadlines, creating your VIP page and more! 		

				Continue Reading >
			

























 
Academic Affairs is responsible for the formulation and implementation of academic policies, priorities, and for the allocation of resources to carry these matters forward. The division is led by the lead academic officer, the Provost and Executive Vice President for Academic Affairs.
The division of Academic Affairs includes:

College of Agriculture, Food, and Environmental Sciences 
College of Architecture and Environmental Design
Orfalea College of Business 
College of Engineering
College of Liberal Arts
College of Science and Mathematics


Academic Innovations and Programs
Extended, Professional and Continuing Education (EPaCE)
International Programs
Kennedy Library
University Advising
